identificationModule.briefTitle: DermaClose DUKE Fasciotomy and Wound Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: DermaClose Continuous External Tissue Expander for the Management of Four-Compartment Fasciotomy and Full-Thickness Wounds.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To evaluate the clinical performance of DermaClose and DermaClose XL Continuous External Tissue Expander (CETE) devices to reduce wound size and/or assist with closure in acute full thickness wounds of the skin and assess the need for skin grafting for patients undergoing a four-compartment leg fasciotomy.

armGroups.label: Wound on either the upper or lower extremity with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL
interventionNames: Device: DermaClose Continuous External Tissue Expander Device
Device: DermaClose XL Continuous External Tissue Expander Device

armGroups.label: Wound undergoing fasciotomy with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL
interventionNames: Device: DermaClose Continuous External Tissue Expander Device
Device: DermaClose XL Continuous External Tissue Expander Device

armGroups.label: Wound undergoing fasciotomy with conventional wound dressings

interventions.name: DermaClose Continuous External Tissue Expander Device
interventions.description: Constant tension and self-tensioning device. Supplied sterile and for single use only.
armGroupLabels: Wound on either the upper or lower extremity with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL
Wound undergoing fasciotomy with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL

interventions.name: DermaClose XL Continuous External Tissue Expander Device
interventions.description: Intended for large wounds that are greater than 8 cm in width. Constant tension and self-tensioning device. Supplied sterile and for single use only
armGroupLabels: Wound on either the upper or lower extremity with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL
Wound undergoing fasciotomy with DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL

interventions.name: Conventional wound dressings
interventions.description: Wet-to-dry, gauze, and negative pressure wound therapy.
armGroupLabels: Wound undergoing fasciotomy with conventional wound dressings

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of investigator-confirmed wound size reduction or assistance with closure of acute full thickness wounds
primaryOutcomes.description: Wounds may result from four-compartment leg fasciotomies.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 14 Days (or longer if deemed necessary by surgeon)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean percentage of wound size reduction
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculated at time of device removal.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 14 Days (or longer if deemed necessary by surgeon)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Median number of days until wound closure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as the ability to complete surgical closure.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 14 Days (or longer if deemed necessary by surgeon)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of wounds treated with subsequent reconstruction with a skin graft after fasciotomy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Plastic surgery may be consulted for reconstruction by the referring surgeon, or the patient may be recommended for study inclusion by the referring surgeon who plans on using conventional dressing to manage the wound(s).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of wounds requiring subsequent surgical procedure(s) for wound closure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Includes participants with conventional closure modality or skin graft

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of days until hospital discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Median time (min, max) in days will be calculated.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient is at least 18 years of age at the time of consent.
* Patient with a full thickness acute wound(s) of the skin:

  1. On either the upper or lower extremity (including four-compartment leg fasciotomy), in whom DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL is applied during surgery, OR
  2. Undergoing a four-compartment leg fasciotomy requiring conventional wound dressing.
* Patient has signed a written informed consent form (ICF) per 21 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 50.55(e).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient in whom the product was used off-label (except for patients who have the device on for longer than 14 days)
* Patient with wound(s) that exhibit any of the following:

  * Ischemic tissue,
  * Infected tissue,
  * Acute burned tissue,
  * Fragile tissue at the edges of the wound(s).
* Patient, who in surgeon's opinion, does not fit the criteria for this study.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The study population will include patients who have acute full thickness wound(s) of the skin (including four-compartment leg fasciotomy) and in whom DermaClose and/or DermaClose XL, or conventional dressing is used.

centralContacts.name: Baxter Clinical Trials Disclosure Call Center

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Sharing of Clinical Trial Data: Baxter is committed to sharing clinical trial data with external medical experts and scientific researchers in the interest of advancing public health. As such, Baxter will supply anonymized Individual Patient Datasets (IPD) and supporting documents (synopsis of clinical study reports, protocol and SAP's)
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Upon approval of a legitimate research request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Research requests will be reviewed by qualified medical and scientific experts within the company. If Baxter agrees to the release of clinical data for research purposes, the requestor will be required to sign a data sharing agreement (DSA) in order to ensure protection of patient confidentiality and any intellectual property rights of Baxter prior to the release of any data.
